TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EcmDocumentRoutingWeb extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a repository abstraction that can be configured to automatically organize and manage incoming content.

remarks.para: This class represents a managed Web site that enables a single point of document submission. This site forms the end point of the document submission Web service. See MS-OFFICIALFILE documentation on MSDN in SharePoint Products and Technologies Protocols for more information.

You can configure the content organizer with rules that specify the final location of a document. Only the owners of the site or users specified as RouterOwners for this site are allowed to configure the rules. Any document that cannot be organized by the specified rules will be placed in the drop-off library and is visible only to the submitter and the RouterOwners.

An EcmDocumentRoutingWeb can also specify whether folders are automatically created at the final location specified by the rule matching the document. The EcmDocumentRoutingWeb can be configured to create folders automatically after a threshold limit of documents has been reached at the final location.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWeb web) cil managed

Docs.param: Web site that can be configured to organize documents automatically.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of a object for the specified Web site.

remarks.para: The object has to be a valid content organizer-enabled site in order to perform the operations provided by the EcmDocumentRoutingWeb.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddCustomRouter (string routerName, string assemblyName, string className);
.method public hidebysig instance void AddCustomRouter(string routerName, string assemblyName, string className) cil managed
Public Sub AddCustomRouter (routerName As String, assemblyName As String, className As String)
public: void AddCustomRouter(System::String ^ routerName, System::String ^ assemblyName, System::String ^ className);

Docs.param: Name of the assembly containing the implementation of the ICustomRouter interface.
Name of the class that implements the ICustomRouter interface.
Docs.summary: Registers a custom router with the content organizer-enabled site

remarks.para: Use a custom router to perform custom processing on incoming documents. Custom routers that are already registered with the EcmDocumentRoutingWeb can be specified in rules and will be run on documents matching that rule.

public: property Microsoft::SharePoint::SPList ^ DropOffZone { Microsoft::SharePoint::SPList ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the document library representing a single point of submission in the content organizer-enabled site.

public: property System::String ^ DropOffZoneUrl { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the absolute URL of the single point of submission in the content organizer-enabled site.

Docs.summary: Gets whether the site is configured to organize e-mails.
Docs.value: true if the site is configured to organize e-mails; otherwise, false.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsRoutingEnabled As Boolean
public: property bool IsRoutingEnabled { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets whether the Web site is a valid content organizer enabled site.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RemoveCustomRouter(string routerName) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the custom router to be removed.
Docs.summary: Removes a custom router registered with the content organizer-enabled site.

remarks.para: A custom router can be used to perform custom processing on incoming documents. Custom routers that are already registered with the EcmDocumentRoutingWeb can be specified in rules and will be run for documents matching that rule.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Router As EcmDocumentRouter

Docs.summary: Gets the content organizer associated with this site.

remarks.para: The object is the core of the content organizer which evaluates rules and places documents in the location configured for their metadata.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property RoutingRuleCollection As EcmDocumentRouterRuleCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of rules that specifies the final location for incoming documents.
